result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession of a Firearm While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn C. Batie

records.addlTxt:
9:41 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Deshawn C. Batie appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Karleigh K. Miller in court for Deshawn C. Batie. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 10/12/2022 at 1:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:43 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Deshawn C. Batie appeared by video via Zoom.  Attorney Karleigh K. Miller in court for Deshawn C. Batie. Attorney Miller states an offer has been received but time is needed to review. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/24/2022 at 2:15 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CK 43955 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail refunded.

Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.

Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant advises is planning to retain Attorney Karleigh Miller.
